basic.description: This course is an introduction to the ways "multiculturalism" is conceived, practiced, and represented in contemporary U.S. society. Multicultural literature signifies the study of literature and other cultural forms against and through categories of identity such as class, gender, race, and sexuality.
basic.subject: LAE
basic.title: Multicultural Literature

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: Completion of all English Education admission requirements, including prerequisites, GPA, and FTCE General Knowledge exam.
